item.title: IOL, conclusion: wajah tersedu-sedu
item.description: The last few days of the IOL, as well as the several months to follow. (See part 1, part 2, and part 3.)

item.title: IOL, days 5-6: Seven pineapples
item.description: The 2017 IOL individual contest has just ended! (See part 1 and part 2.)

item.title: IOL, day 4: Hunting Hamilton
item.description: Adventures prior to the opening ceremony of IOL! (See part 1.)

item.title: IOL, days 1-4: We need to remove Andy's brain
item.description: I'm going to the International Linguistics Olympiad! So I figured I'd document what happens along the way.

item.title: On math and memorization
item.description: Some thoughts on the current state of math education and how it could be improved.

item.title: Permission creep
item.description: A novice monk, walking through the temple, came across a master performing system administration tasks.

item.title: The One True Date/Time Format
item.description: Everybody I meet seems to have a different way of writing down dates and times. Of the myriad of possibilities, to me, there's one that makes the most sense.

item.title: On the merits of "roll your own blog engine"
item.description: This blog, along with the rest of my website, runs on a (currently, as of 1st draft) 214 SLOC Rust backend. So my first blog post might as well be an explanation of why I chose to do it this way.
